result.execSummary:
The defendant Armando T Trevino was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Illegal Articles to Inmate [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 302.095(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Christopher Selby. Defendant is prohibited from being on the premises of any correctional facility unless an inmate of said facility.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber-No Good Time credit. Court does not object to jail transfer.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 2:15 pm case called. Defendant Armando T Trevino in court with attorney Kristina Marie Sanders-Brown.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached w/argued sentence.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Sanders-Brown. No statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: 90 days WCJ with Huber-No GT Credit. No credit for time served. To be served no later than May 15, 2015. No objection to jail transfer. No contact with Christopher Selby. Prohibited from being on the premises of any correctional facility unless an inmate of said facility.  Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs to include DNA surcharge and attorney fees of $740.60 to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-27-2015 02:00 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 4, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
from Atty Sanders-Brown requesting a plea/sentencing hearing

Status conference on January 20, 2015 at 10:10 am.

Case called @ 2:40 p.m. Defendant Armando T Trevino in court with attorney Kristina Marie Sanders-Brown.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Infomation filed by ADA Anderson. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG Plea entered. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 10:10 am.
